links.title: Tesla cuts Model 3 part orders to Taiwan supplier Hota: report
links.description: TAIPEI (Reuters) - Luxury electric carmaker Tesla () plans to slash by 40 percent its orders for parts for the new Model 3 mass-market sedan from Taiwanese auto component maker Hota Industrial Mfg. Co () from December, according to a media report.

links.title: Tesla running behind Musk's driverless promises
links.description: A year ago, Tesla Inc. set up a hastily organized conference call between Elon Musk and reporters. Tesla had something big to announce big enough for the chief executive to open the floor to questions. That doesn't happen very often. What followed wasn't so much the unveiling of a new product as a plan for a product.

messages.body: $TSLA Even the robots are against Elon Musk, lol. Middle of video he gets a mention https://www.cnbc.com/2017/10/26/elon-musk-sophia-robot-ai.html

links.title: A robot threw shade at Elon Musk so the billionaire hit back
links.description: A robot poked fun at Elon Musk but the billionaire didn't take it lying down. On Wednesday, CNBC's Andrew Ross Sorkin spoke to Sophia, a robot developed by Hanson Robotics. It's a robot with a human face that has the ability to respond to questions.

links.title: Is The $136 Billion Debt Of General Electric A Deterrent?
links.description: When running scans on free cash flow yield, I noticed General Electric Company (NYSE: GE) back in Q2 of 2016 to have a confusing outlook. Why would a company with negative free cash flow/FCF be so loved, pumped and even continue to offer the dividend while cash reserves depleted?
